name: Potatoes baked in a uniform
description: Fragrant, hearty, sizzling homemade potatoes stuffed with sour cream and bacon filling is a very simple and very effective way to feed a large number of people, practically without spending any money on cooking strength, no time. If desired, you can replace ordinary potatoes with sweet potatoes, and add, for example, corn or sweet red pepper to the filling.

name: Tomato Maghreb soup
description: Tomato Maghreb soup is especially common in Morocco and Tunisia. It is very easy to prepare and light in itself — based on tomatoes and chicken broth. In addition to them, the soup contains only the necessary spices, honey and lemon, which all together convey the same oriental flavor. The taste of the soup depends entirely on the quality of tomatoes. Fresh cilantro and individual lemon slices will complement the dish.

name: Pumpkin cream soup
description: A portrait of this orange soup adorns the cover of the book «La Cuisine du Marché» by Paul Bocuse. Bocuse, who invented the so—called new cuisine, considered pumpkin one of the foundations of this world order, and pumpkin soup - a kind of amniotic fluid of gastronomy.

name: Red bean salad with cottage cheese
description: Tuscan salad, aged in the colors of the Italian flag. Literally a few spoons are enough to form a pleasant heaviness in the stomach. A very useful thing from the point of view of the morning, when it is difficult to cram large doses of biomass into yourself, but you want to eat at the same time.

name: Classic Greek salad
description: This is a recipe from an old cookbook brought from Greece. The secret of the salad is the freshest vegetables and good feta. Only olive oil is used for the salad, and spices such as oregano and basil are the hallmark of Greek cuisine.

name: Blueberry and nutmeg muffins
description: The iconic berry, which we have learned to produce all year round, in combination with a loose dough is an absolutely win—win option. Blueberry muffins have become a popular dessert in England and America, although their origin is French. And in general, these little sweet cupcakes, as we know them now, were conceived as ordinary bread and tasted neutral.

name: Azu in Tatar
description: One of the few dishes awarded in the Soviet food tradition of selling with a nominal cut. And to this day, in cookeries and supermarkets, you can find beef that is cut into strips and sold as an azu. There are still disputes about the dish itself, how and with what to cook: use beef or lamb, ghee or plain butter, stew in a cauldron or a saucepan with a thick bottom. There may be many versions of this dish, but its basis is always the same — it is sliced meat, potatoes and tomato sauce.

name: Fried rice with egg in Chinese
description: Fried rice is a fairly common ingredient in East Asian cuisine — you can cook, in fact, from the remains of yesterday's dinner. Only well-cooled, pre-cooked rice, ideally standing all night in the refrigerator, when it gets into a hot wok, will not spread to the state of porridge and will not turn the contents of the frying pan into a clumsy shapeless lump.
